page.title: 09POPULATION IN HENLLAN
page.content:
\\
The population of the block is approx. 700,most of whom live in the village of Henllan.The remainder live in isolated farmhouses.Two thirds of the people were born in Wales,the rest being English.Just over a 1/4 are under 16 whilst just under 1/5 are over the age of 65. The population has grown considerably in the last 15 years mainly by migration. There are few places of employment in the block and most workers have to travel varying distances to work.Due to a limited public transport service with only one bus route to Denbigh there is a dependence on private car transport. There is a high level of car ownership - 1 car per household.
